Comment: Florida did something very  cool years ago.  They passed legislation that basically froze tuition at Florida Universities and Colleges. Yes the schools bitched, whined, complained, and threw a temper tantrum.  But then they lived within that budgetary restraint and something amazing happened - not a damn thing.  Administration discovered how to budget, they found that spending (literally) over six figures for an open bar for a huge administration and educator cocktail event.  They cold back off on student recreation like climbing walls and recreation pools that were starting to make a 5 star resort pool look lame.    And they could, if they tried - offer an absolutely kick ass **education** at the same time. And they did try, and most schools have done a fantastic job.  Florida public universities are now ranked among the top of the nation, while offering some of the lowest tuition in the entire nation.
